Description: An attempt by one player to play the ball to a team mate (includes set pieces)
A pass attempt where the intended receiving player is called offside
An attempt by one player to dribble past an opponent
Indicates a foul has been committed. The event comes in pairs, with one for the team committing the foul (has outcome = 0) and another for the team fouled (outcome = 1).

Indicates the ball has gone out of play for a throw-in or goal kick. The event comes in pairs, with one for the team who have put the ball out of play (outcome = 0) and another for the team who will resume the match in possession (outcome = 1).

Indicates the ball has gone out of play for a corner kick. The event comes in pairs, with one for the team who have conceded the corner (outcome = 0) and another for the team who have won the corner (outcome = 1).
A player successfully dispossess an opponent of the ball. Outcome = 1: tackling player's team gains possession or the ball goes out of play. Outcome = 0: possession remains with the opponent.
When a player intercepts any pass event between opposition players and prevents the ball reaching its target. Cannot be a clearance.
Goalkeeper event; saving a shot on goal. Can also be an outfield player event with qualifier 94 for blocked shot.
Goalkeeper only event; goalkeeper attempts to catch an aerial ball.
Player deliberately attempts to clear away/put the ball out of play without intentionally targeting the ball towards a team mate.
A shot which goes/is projected to travel wide or over the goal.
A shot which directly hits the frame of the goal.
A shot which is saved by the goalkeeper or blocked by an opposition player. The player performing the event is the shooter.
All goals.
A player is given a card by the referee; qualifiers will indicate whether this was a yellow, second yellow or straight red, as well as the reason for the card
Player is substituted off.
Player comes on as a substitute <./td>
Player is forced to leave the pitch due to injury and the team have no substitutions left.
Player comes back on the pitch.
When an outfield player has to replace the goalkeeper.
Goalkeeper becomes an outfield player.
Change in playing conditions.
Referee or linesman is replaced.
Used tp signify the start of a stoppage in play, such as a player injured on the field.
Used when the stoppage ends and play resumes.
End of a match period.
Start of a match period.
The qualifiers on this event show team lineup and formation information.
Player moved to a different position, but the team formation remained the same.
Player is forced to change jersey number; an associated qualifier will show the new number.
Signals that the match is over and data collection has been completed.
Goal has occurred but it is pending additional detail qualifiers from Opta. Will change to event 16.
Shot on goal has occurred but is pending additional detail qualifiers from Opta. Will change to event 15.
Team alters its formation.
Goalkeeper only event; goalkeeper punches the ball.
Event has been deleted â€“ the event will remain as it was originally with the same ID but will be resent with the type altered to 43.
Two players from opposing teams contest an aerial ball; these events come in pairs, one for each player, with the outcome indicating the success/failure of the aerial duel.
A player unsuccessfully attempts to tackle an opponent, making no contact with the ball as the opponent dribbles past them.
This can occur post match if the referee rescinds a card he has awarded
A player gathers the ball and gains control of possession for his team.
Player is successfully tackled and loses possession of the ball
An error by a player, resulting in a shot or goal by the opposition.
Goalkeeper only event; goalkeeper picks up the ball.
Goalkeeper only event; goalkeeper attempts to catch a cross and fails to make contact with the ball.
Goalkeeper only event; goalkeeper covers a ground ball in the box and collects it.
Awarded to last defender when an offside decision is given against an attacker.
A player uses his body to shield the ball from an opponent as it rolls out of play.

A player takes a throw-in incorrectly, resulting in the throw being awarded to the other team. These events come in pairs; one for the player who commits the foul throw, another for the team that is then awarded the throw-in.
Goalkeeper only event; goalkeeper faces an opposition penalty.
Goalkeeper only event; goalkeeper comes off his line to clear or claim the ball.
Used when a team does not actually have a shot on goal, but was in a good position to score and a player failed to generate a shot on goal.

A player unsuccessfully controls the ball and loses possession. Outcome = 1: the ball just unintentionally hit the player, who made no attempt to control it. Outcome = 0: the player attempted to control the ball and failed.
An event indicating a save has occurred but without full details. Event 10 will follow shortly afterwards with full details.
Match resumes on a new date after being abandoned mid game.
Any major talking point or error made by the referee â€“ decision will be assigned to the relevant team.
Possession event will appear every 5 mins.
Two players run in and contend for a loose ball. These events come in pairs, one for each player; outcome = 1 indicates who gets to the ball first. GERMAN ONLY.
Occurs after an End Delay when a match resumes, having been stopped by the referee with the ball in play. This event comes in pairs, with one for each team.
A player fails to block a pass or shot attempt, despite being 1m or less from the attempt.
Used when the amount of injury time is announced; the number of minutes added on is shown by an associated qualifier.
The qualifiers on this event identify team coaches and their roles.
Indicates that a player has been caught offside.

This is an automated extra event for DFL. It comes with a tackle or an interception and indicates if the player who made the tackle/interception retained the ball after this action or if the tackle/interception was a single ball touch (other ball contact with type â€œinterceptionâ€, type â€œDefensive Clearanceâ€ or type â€œTackleRetainedBallâ€).
A player blocks a pass attempt by an opponent; similar to an Interception, but the player is already very close to the ball.
The match has had an early end.
Event indicating that a player is now off the pitch.
